description: Not described in the literature, this is a reed stop of the Regal class with short, cylindrical resonators. When played staccato, its tones are supposed to resemble those of a harpsichord (cembalo).
examplesDescription: All known examples are listed below.

examples.name: Cembaloregal 4', Brustwerk; Marienorgel, Münster, Freiburg, Germany; Rieger 1965.
Cembaloregal 8', Manual II; Maritim Grand Hotel, Berlin, Germany; Jehmlich 1987.
Cembaloregal 8', Manual II; private residence, Frankfurt am Main-Eschersheim, Germany; Oberlinger 1968.
